intro: Tetrapterys discolor, commonly known as the pink spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and unique floral structures. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in cup-like structures called cyathia, which are surrounded by colorful bracts. Tetrapterys discolor is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
